<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Legal
    Proceedings</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    From time to time, claims are made against Brocade in the
    ordinary course of its business, which could result in
    litigation. Claims and associated litigation are subject to
    inherent uncertainties and unfavorable outcomes could occur,
    such as monetary damages, fines, penalties or injunctions
    prohibiting Brocade from selling one or more products or
    engaging in other activities. The occurrence of an unfavorable
    outcome in any specific period could have a material adverse
    affect on Brocade&#146;s results of operations for that period
    or future periods.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On July&#160;20, 2001, the first of a number of putative class
    actions for violations of the federal securities laws was filed
    in the United States District Court for the Southern District of
    New York against Brocade, certain of its officers and directors,
    and certain of the underwriters for Brocade&#146;s initial
    public offering of securities. A consolidated amended class
    action captioned In Re Brocade Communications Systems, Inc.
    Initial Public Offering Securities Litigation was filed on
    April&#160;19, 2002. The complaint generally alleges that
    various underwriters engaged in improper and undisclosed
    activities related to the allocation of shares in Brocade&#146;s
    initial public offering and seeks unspecified damages on behalf
    of a purported class of purchasers of common stock from
    May&#160;24, 1999 to December&#160;6, 2000. The lawsuit against
    Brocade is being coordinated for pretrial proceedings with a
    number of other pending litigations challenging underwriter
    practices in over 300 cases as In Re Initial Public Offering
    Securities Litigation, 21 MC 92(SAS). In October 2002, the
    individual defendants were dismissed without prejudice from the
    action, pursuant to a tolling agreement. On February&#160;19,
    2003, the Court issued an Opinion and Order dismissing all of
    the plaintiffs&#146; claims against Brocade. In June 2004, a
    stipulation of settlement for the claims against the issuer
    defendants, including Brocade, was submitted to the Court for
    approval. On August&#160;31, 2005, the Court granted preliminary
    approval of the settlement. On April&#160;24, 2006 the Court
    held a fairness hearing in connection with the motion for final
    approval of the settlement. The Court has yet to issue a ruling
    on the motion for final approval. The settlement remains subject
    to a number of conditions, including final approval by the
    Court. On December&#160;5, 2006, the Court of Appeals for the
    Second Circuit reversed the court&#146;s October 2004 order
    certifying a class in six test cases that were selected by the
    underwriter defendants and plaintiffs in the coordinated
    proceeding. Brocade is not one of the test cases and it is
    unclear what impact this will have on the class certified in
    Brocade&#146;s case.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On May&#160;16, 2005, Brocade announced that the SEC and the
    Department of Justice, or the DOJ, are conducting an
    investigation regarding Brocade&#146;s historical stock option
    granting processes. Brocade has been cooperating with the SEC
    and DOJ. During the first quarter of fiscal year 2006, Brocade
    began active settlement discussions with the Staff of the
    SEC&#146;s Division of Enforcement, or the Staff, regarding its
    financial restatements related to stock option accounting. As a
    result of these discussions, for the three months ended
    January&#160;28, 2006, Brocade recorded $7.0&#160;million
    provision for an estimated settlement expense. The
    $7.0&#160;million estimated settlement expense is based on an
    offer of settlement that Brocade made to the Staff and for which
    the Staff has noted it intends on recommending to the SEC&#146;s
    Commissioners. The offer of settlement is contingent upon final
    approval by the SEC&#146;s Commissioners.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Beginning on or about May&#160;19, 2005, several securities
    class action complaints were filed against Brocade and certain
    of its current and former officers. These actions were filed in
    the United States District Court for the Northern District of
    California on behalf of purchasers of Brocade&#146;s stock from
    February 2001 to May 2005. These lawsuits followed
    Brocade&#146;s restatement of certain financial results due to
    stock-based compensation accounting issues. On January&#160;12,
    2006, the Court appointed a lead plaintiff and lead counsel. On
    April&#160;14, 2006, the lead plaintiff filed a consolidated
    complaint on behalf of purchasers of Brocade&#146;s stock from
    May 2000 to May 2005. The consolidated complaint alleges, among
    other things, violations of sections&#160;10(b) and 20(a) of the
    Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rule&#160;10b-5</FONT>
    promulgated thereunder. The consolidated complaint generally
    alleges that Brocade and the individual defendants made false or
    misleading public statements regarding Brocade&#146;s business
    and operations and seeks unspecified monetary damages and other
    relief against the defendants. These lawsuits followed
    Brocade&#146;s restatement of certain financial results due to
    stock-based compensation accounting issues.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Beginning on or about May&#160;24, 2005, several derivative
    actions were also filed against certain of Brocade&#146;s
    current and former directors and officers. These actions were
    filed in the United States District Court for the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    76
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Northern District of California and in the California Superior
    Court in Santa&#160;Clara County. The complaints allege that
    certain of Brocade&#146;s officers and directors breached their
    fiduciary duties to Brocade by engaging in alleged wrongful
    conduct including conduct complained of in the securities
    litigation described above. Brocade is named solely as a nominal
    defendant against whom the plaintiffs seek no recovery. The
    derivative actions pending in the District Court for the
    Northern District of California were consolidated and the Court
    created a Lead Counsel structure. The derivative plaintiffs
    filed a consolidated complaint in the District Court for the
    Northern District of California on October&#160;7, 2005, and
    Brocade filed a motion to dismiss that action on
    October&#160;27, 2005. On January&#160;6, 2006, Brocade&#146;s
    motion was granted and the consolidated complaint in the
    District Court for the Northern District of California was
    dismissed with leave to amend. The parties to this action
    subsequently reached a preliminary settlement, which remains
    subject to approval by the Court.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The derivative actions pending in the Superior Court in
    Santa&#160;Clara County were consolidated. The derivative
    plaintiffs filed a consolidated complaint in the Superior Court
    in Santa&#160;Clara County on September&#160;19, 2005. Brocade
    filed a motion to stay that action in deference to the
    substantially identical consolidated derivative action pending
    in the District Court for the Northern District of California,
    and on November&#160;15, 2005, the Court stayed the action. In
    October 2006, the Court partially lifted the stay and granted
    plaintiffs leave to file an amended complaint. On
    November&#160;13, 2006, plaintiffs filed an amended complaint.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    No amounts have been recorded in Brocade&#146;s Consolidated
    Financial Statements associated with these matters as the
    amounts are not estimable other than the $7.0&#160;million
    provision for an estimated settlement expense with the SEC as
    noted above.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Integration
    costs</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On August&#160;8, 2006, the Company announced that it had
    entered into a definitive agreement to acquire McDATA
    Corporation (&#147;McDATA&#148;) in an all stock transaction
    valued at approximately $634&#160;million as of such date. Under
    the terms of the agreement, McDATA stockholders will receive
    0.75&#160;shares of Brocade common stock for each share of
    McDATA class&#160;A common stock and each share of McDATA
    class&#160;B common stock they hold. The acquisition is subject
    to obtaining approval from both Brocade and McDATA stockholders,
    regulatory approvals and certain other closing conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In connection with the proposed acquisition of McDATA, the
    Company recorded acquisition and integration costs of
    $9.6&#160;million for the year ended October&#160;28, 2006,
    which consisted primarily of costs incurred for consulting
    services and other professional fees. No amounts have been
    recorded in Brocade&#146;s Consolidated Financial Statements
    associated with acquisition and integration costs related to the
    Company&#146;s proposed acquisition of McDATA other than the
    $9.6&#160;million as noted above.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">11.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stockholders&#146;
    Equity</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock
    Option Exchange Program</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On December&#160;9, 2002, the Company announced that its Board
    of Directors approved a voluntary stock option exchange program
    (the Exchange Program) for employees. Under the Exchange
    Program, employees were offered the opportunity to exchange an
    aggregate of approximately 67.3&#160;million outstanding stock
    options with exercise prices equal to or greater than
    $12.00&#160;per share for new stock options to be granted at an
    exchange ratio determined by the date the exchanged stock
    options were granted. Participating employees other than the
    then Chief Executive Officer (CEO) would receive new stock
    options in exchange for their eligible outstanding stock options
    at an exchange ratio of either 1 for&#160;1, 1 for&#160;2, or 1
    for&#160;3, depending on the grant date of the exchanged stock
    option. The then CEO would receive new stock options in exchange
    for eligible outstanding stock options at an exchange ratio of 1
    for 10.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In accordance with the Exchange Program, on January&#160;9,
    2003, the Company cancelled 58.7&#160;million outstanding stock
    options and issued promises to grant new stock options to
    participating employees. On July&#160;10,
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    77
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    2003, the first business day that was six months and one day
    after the cancellation of the exchanged options, the Company
    granted to participating employees 26.6&#160;million new stock
    options at an exercise price of $6.54&#160;per share. The
    exercise price per share of the new stock options was equal to
    the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock at the
    close of regular trading on July&#160;10, 2003. As of
    October&#160;28, 2006, 8.9&#160;million of these options, or
    approximately three percent of the Company&#146;s outstanding
    common stock, remain outstanding and could have a dilutive
    effect on the Company&#146;s future earnings per share to the
    extent that the future market price of the Company&#146;s common
    stock exceeds $6.54&#160;per share. No financial or accounting
    effect to the Company&#146;s financial position, results of
    operations, or cash flows for the years ended October&#160;28,
    2006, October&#160;29, 2005 and October&#160;30, 2004 was
    associated with this transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Tender
    Offer</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On June&#160;12, 2006, the Company completed a tender offer that
    allowed employees to amend or cancel certain options to remedy
    potential adverse personal tax consequences. As a result, the
    Company amended certain options granted after August&#160;14,
    2003 that were or may have been granted at a discount and were
    tendered by employees to increase the option grant price to the
    fair market value on the date of grant, and to give the employee
    a cash payment for the difference in option grant price between
    the amended option and the original discounted price. In
    addition, the Company cancelled certain options granted prior to
    August&#160;14, 2003 that were or may have been granted at a
    discount, and were tendered by employees in exchange for a cash
    payment based on the Black-Scholes value of the option. The
    Company has accounted for these modifications and settlements in
    accordance with SFAS&#160;123R and as a result recorded
    incremental compensation expense of $2.1&#160;million during the
    year ended October&#160;28, 2006 and recognized a liability of
    $3.3&#160;million for the cash payments that will be made to
    employees in January 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stockholder
    Rights Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On February&#160;5, 2002, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors
    adopted a stockholder rights plan. Under the plan, the Company
    declared and paid a dividend of one right for each share of
    common stock held by stockholders of record as of the close of
    business on February&#160;19, 2002. Each right initially
    entitles stockholders to purchase a fractional share of the
    Company&#146;s preferred stock at $280&#160;per share. However,
    the rights are not immediately exercisable and will become
    exercisable only upon the occurrence of certain events. If a
    person or group acquires or announces a tender or exchange offer
    that would result in the acquisition of 15&#160;percent or more
    of the Company&#146;s common stock while the stockholder rights
    plan remains in place, then, unless the rights are redeemed by
    the Company for $0.001&#160;per right, the rights will become
    exercisable by all rights holders except the acquiring person or
    group for shares of the Company or the third party acquirer
    having a value of twice the right&#146;s then-current exercise
    price. The stockholder rights plan may have the effect of
    deterring or delaying a change in control of Brocade.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    Stock Purchase Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 1999, the Board of Directors approved the adoption of
    the Company&#146;s 1999 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (the
    Purchase Plan), and the Company&#146;s shareholders approved the
    Purchase Plan in April 1999. The Purchase Plan permits eligible
    employees to purchase shares of the Company&#146;s common stock
    through payroll deductions at 85&#160;percent of the fair market
    value at certain plan-defined dates. The maximum number of
    shares of the Company&#146;s common stock available for sale
    under the Purchase Plan is 37.2&#160;million shares, plus an
    annual increase to be added on the first day of the
    Company&#146;s fiscal year, equal to the lesser of
    20.0&#160;million shares, or 2.5&#160;percent of the outstanding
    shares of common stock at such date. Accordingly, on
    October&#160;29, 2006 and October&#160;30, 2005,
    6.8&#160;million and 6.7&#160;million additional shares,
    respectively, were made available for issuance under the
    Purchase Plan. During the years ended October&#160;28, 2006,
    October&#160;29, 2005, and October&#160;30, 2004, the Company
    issued 2.9&#160;million shares, 2.8&#160;million shares, and
    2.3&#160;million shares, respectively, under the Purchase Plan.
    At October&#160;28, 2006, 32.2&#160;million shares were
    available for future issuance under the Purchase Plan.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    78
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">1999&#160;Director
    Option Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 1999, the Board of Directors approved the
    1999&#160;Director Option Plan (the &#147;Director Plan&#148;)
    and the Company&#146;s shareholders approved the Director Plan
    in April 1999. The Director Plan provides for the grant of
    common stock to Directors of the Company. At October&#160;28,
    2006, the Company had reserved 1.5&#160;million shares of
    authorized but unissued shares of common stock for future
    issuance under the Director Plan. Of this amount,
    0.9&#160;million shares were outstanding, and 0.6&#160;million
    shares were available for future grants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">1999
    Stock Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 1999, the Board of Directors approved the
    Company&#146;s 1999 Stock Plan (the &#147;1999 Plan&#148;) and
    the Company&#146;s shareholders approved the 1999 Plan in April
    1999. The 1999 Plan provides for the grant of incentive stock
    options, nonstatutory stock options and restricted stock to
    employees and consultants (other than with respect to incentive
    stock options). Per the terms of the 1999 Plan, the maximum
    number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock available
    for sale under the 1999 Plan is 132.0&#160;million shares, plus
    an annual increase to be added on the first day of the
    Company&#146;s fiscal year, equal to the lesser of
    40.0&#160;million shares, or 5.0&#160;percent of the outstanding
    shares of common stock at such date. Accordingly, on
    October&#160;29, 2006 and October&#160;30, 2005,
    13.5&#160;million and 13.5&#160;million additional shares,
    respectively, were made available for grant under the 1999 Plan.
    At October&#160;28, 2006, the Company had reserved
    81.0&#160;million shares of authorized but unissued shares of
    common stock for future issuance under the 1999 Plan. Of this
    amount, 30.0&#160;million shares were outstanding, and
    51.0&#160;million shares were available for future grants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">1999
    Nonstatutory Stock Option Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In September 1999, the Board of Directors approved the
    Company&#146;s 1999 Nonstatutory Stock Option Plan (the
    &#147;NSO Plan&#148;). The NSO Plan provides for the grant of
    nonstatutory stock options to employees and consultants. A total
    of 51.4&#160;million shares of common stock have been reserved
    for issuance under the NSO Plan. At October&#160;28, 2006, the
    Company had reserved approximately 44.0&#160;million shares of
    authorized but unissued shares of common stock for future
    issuance under the NSO Plan. Of this amount, 8.8&#160;million
    shares were outstanding, and 35.2&#160;million shares were
    available for future grants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Rhapsody
    Stock Option Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In January 2003, in connection with the Rhapsody acquisition,
    the Company assumed the Rhapsody&#146;s Stock Option Plan (the
    &#147;Rhapsody Plan&#148;). The Rhapsody Plan provides for the
    grant of incentive stock options
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    nonstatutory stock options to employees and consultants. At
    October&#160;28, 2006, there were less than 0.1&#160;million
    shares outstanding and 0.1&#160;million available shares for
    future grants under the Rhapsody Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Therion
    Stock Option Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In May 2005, in connection with the Therion acquisition, the
    Company assumed the Therion&#146;s Stock Option Plan (the
    &#147;Therion Plan&#148;). The Therion Plan provides for the
    grant of incentive stock options
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    nonstatutory stock options to employees and consultants. At
    October&#160;28, 2006, there were 0.2&#160;million shares
    outstanding under the Therion Plan, and there were no available
    shares for future grants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock
    Options</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company, under the various stock option plans (the
    &#147;Plans&#148;) discussed above, grants stock options for
    shares of common stock to employees and directors. In accordance
    with the Plans, the stated exercise price for non-qualified
    stock options shall not be less than 85&#160;percent of the
    estimated fair market value of common stock on the date of
    grant. Incentive stock options may not be granted at less than
    100&#160;percent of the estimated fair market value of the
    common stock, and stock options granted to a person owning more
    than 10&#160;percent of the combined voting
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    79
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    power of all classes of stock of the Company must be issued at
    110&#160;percent of the fair market value of the stock on the
    date of grant. The Plans provide that the options shall be
    exercisable over a period not to exceed ten years. The majority
    of options granted under the Plans vest over a period of four
    years. Certain options granted under the Plans vest over shorter
    periods. At October&#160;28, 2006, the Company had cumulatively
    reserved 126.9&#160;million shares of authorized but unissued
    shares of common stock for future issuance under the Plans. Of
    this amount, 40.0&#160;million shares were outstanding, and
    86.9&#160;million shares were available for future grants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table summarizes stock option plan activity under
    all of the Plans (in thousands except per share&#160;amounts):
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    From May 1999 through July 2003, the Company granted
    98.8&#160;million options subject to variable accounting as the
    measurement date of the options grant was not certain. As of
    October&#160;28, 2006, 1.8&#160;million options with a weighted
    average exercise price of $15.65 and a weighted average
    remaining life of 4.6&#160;years remain outstanding and continue
    to be accounted for under variable accounting.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The dilutive impact of potential common shares associated with
    stock options, by application of the treasury stock method, for
    the years ended October&#160;28, 2006 and October&#160;29, 2005
    were 4.5&#160;million and 2.1&#160;million, respectively. There
    was no dilutive impact of potential common shares associated
    with stock options, by application of the treasury stock method,
    for the year ended October&#160;30, 2004, as the Company had a
    net loss for that year.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    80
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Consists of the Purchase Plan, the Director Plan, the 1999 Plan,
    the Rhapsody Plan, and the Therion Plan. Both the Rhapsody Plan
    and Therion Plan were assumed in connection with acquisitions.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (2) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Consists solely of the NSO Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (3) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Excludes purchase rights accruing under the Purchase Plan. As of
    October&#160;28, 2006, the Purchase Plan had a
    shareholder-approved reserve of 43.9&#160;million shares, of
    which 32.2&#160;million shares were available for future
    issuance.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (4) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Consists of shares available for future issuance under the
    Purchase Plan, the Director Plan, the 1999 Plan, the Rhapsody
    Plan, and the Therion Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (5) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Substantially all shares were granted prior to fiscal year ended
    October&#160;25, 2003.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    401(k) Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company sponsors the Brocade Communications Systems, Inc.
    401(k) Plan (the Plan), which qualifies under
    Section&#160;401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code and is designed
    to provide retirement benefits for its eligible employees
    through tax deferred salary deductions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Through December&#160;31, 2001, employees could contribute from
    1&#160;percent to 20&#160;percent of their eligible compensation
    to the Plan. Effective January&#160;1, 2002, the employee
    contribution limit was increased to 60&#160;percent of eligible
    compensation. Employee contributions are limited to a maximum
    annual amount as set periodically by the Internal Revenue
    Service. The Company matches employee contributions dollar for
    dollar up to a maximum of $1,500&#160;per year per person.
    Effective October&#160;30, 2005, the Company matches employee
    contributions dollar for dollar up to a maximum of
    $2,000&#160;per year per person. All matching contributions vest
    immediately. The Company&#146;s matching contributions to the
    Plan totaled $1.6&#160;million, $1.4&#160;million, and
    $1.5&#160;million, for the years ended October&#160;28, 2006,
    October&#160;29, 2005, and October&#160;30, 2004, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">12.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    Benefit and Stock-Based Compensation Plans</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Stock
    Options</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    When the measurement date is certain, the fair value of each
    option grant is estimated on the date of grant using the
    Black-Scholes valuation model and the assumptions noted in the
    following table. The expected term of stock options is based on
    the midpoint of the historical exercise behavior and uniform
    exercise behavior. The expected volatility is based on an equal
    weighted average of implied volatilities from traded options of
    the Company&#146;s stock
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    81
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    and historical volatility of the Company&#146;s stock. The
    risk-free interest rate is based on the implied yield on a
    U.S.&#160;Treasury zero-coupon issue with a remaining term equal
    to the expected term of the option. The dividend yield reflects
    that Brocade has not paid any cash dividends since inception and
    does not anticipate paying cash dividends in the foreseeable
    future.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company recorded $15.4&#160;million of compensation expense
    related to stock options for the fiscal year ended
    October&#160;28, 2006, in accordance with SFAS&#160;123R. For
    the fiscal year ended October&#160;29, 2005, a total of $(0.6)
    million was recorded for compensation expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The weighted-average fair value of employee stock options
    granted during the years ended October&#160;28, 2006,
    October&#160;29, 2005 and October&#160;30, 2004 were $2.17,
    $1.85, and $1.99, respectively. The total intrinsic value of
    stock options exercised for the years ended October&#160;28,
    2006, October&#160;29, 2005 and October&#160;30, 2004 was
    $6.5&#160;million, $7.3&#160;million, and $4.6&#160;million,
    respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of October&#160;28, 2006, there was $16.7&#160;million of
    total unrecognized compensation costs related to stock options.
    These costs are expected to be recognized over a weighted
    average period of 1.5&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    Stock Purchase Plan</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under Brocade&#146;s Employee Stock Purchase Plan, eligible
    employees can participate and purchase shares semi-annually
    through payroll deductions at the lower of 85% of the fair
    market value of the stock at the commencement or end of the
    offering period. The Purchase Plan permits eligible employees to
    purchase common stock through payroll deductions for up to 15%
    of qualified compensation. The Company accounts for the Employee
    Stock Purchase Plan as a compensatory plan and recorded
    compensation expense of $4.4&#160;million for the year ended
    October&#160;28, 2006 in accordance with SFAS&#160;123R.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of the purchase right of the Employee Stock
    Purchase Plan shares were estimated at the date of grant using
    the Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following
    weighted average assumptions:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of October&#160;28, 2006, there was $0.4&#160;million of
    total unrecognized compensation costs related to employee stock
    purchases. These costs are expected to be recognized over a
    weighted average period of 0.08&#160;years.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Prior to the Company&#146;s adoption of SFAS&#160;123R, benefits
    of tax deductions in excess of recognized compensation costs
    were reported as operating cash flows. SFAS&#160;123R requires
    that they be recorded as a financing cash inflow rather than
    operating cash flows.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    83
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Restricted
    Stock Awards</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For the years ended October&#160;28, 2006 and October&#160;29,
    2005, Brocade issued restricted stock awards of 1.9&#160;million
    shares and 0.02&#160;million shares, respectively, to certain
    eligible employees at a purchase price of $0.001 and
    $0.01&#160;per share, respectively. These restricted shares are
    not transferable until fully vested and are subject to
    repurchase for all unvested shares upon termination. The fair
    value of each award is based on the Company&#146;s closing stock
    price on the date of grant. Compensation expense computed under
    the fair value method for stock awards issued is amortized over
    the awards&#146; vesting period and was $3.9&#160;million and
    $0.9&#160;million, respectively, for the years ended
    October&#160;28, 2006 and October&#160;29, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The weighted-average fair value of the restricted stock awards
    vested in during the years ended October&#160;28, 2006 and
    October&#160;29, 2005 was zero. The weighted-average fair value
    of the restricted stock awards granted in the years ended
    October&#160;28, 2006 and October&#160;29, 2005 was $4.43 and
    $7.05, respectively.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    84
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    restricted stock awards totaled approximately $4.3&#160;million.
    These costs are expected to be recognized over a weighted
    average period of 1.1&#160;years. A summary of the nonvested

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The difference between the United States federal statutory rate
    and the Company&#146;s income tax provision for financial
    statement purposes consisted of the following:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has the intent to indefinitely reinvest any
    undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries that were not
    repatriated under The American Jobs Creation Act of 2004 (the
    Act) and therefore has not provided deferred taxes on
    approximately $91.1&#160;million of undistributed earnings as of
    October&#160;28, 2006. If these earnings were distributed to the
    United States in the form of dividends or otherwise, or if the
    shares of the relevant foreign subsidiaries were sold or
    otherwise transferred, the Company could be subject to
    additional U.S.&#160;income taxes, subject to an adjustment for
    foreign tax credits, and foreign withholding taxes.
    Determination of the amount of unrecognized deferred income tax
    liability related to these earnings is not practicable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Act was enacted on October&#160;22, 2004. One provision of
    the Act effectively reduces the tax rate on qualifying
    repatriation of earnings held by foreign-based subsidiaries to
    5.25&#160;percent. Normally, such repatriations would be taxed
    at a rate of up to 35&#160;percent. In the fourth quarter of
    fiscal year 2005, the Company made the decision that it would
    repatriate approximately $78.2&#160;million under the Act. After
    the repatriation, the Company did not provide deferred taxes on
    undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries as the Company
    intends to utilize these earnings through expansion of its
    business operations outside the United States for an indefinite
    period of time.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The components of net deferred tax assets are as follows (in
    thousands):
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the year ended October&#160;28, 2006, the Company had a
    decrease in valuation allowance of $16.2&#160;million. In
    assessing the realizability of deferred tax assets, management
    considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion
    or all of deferred tax assets will not be realized. The
    realization of deferred tax assets is based on several factors,
    including the Company&#146;s past earnings and the scheduling of
    deferred tax liabilities and projected income from operating
    activities. Management does not believe it is more likely than
    not that the company&#146;s deferred tax assets are realizable.
    The amount of the deferred tax asset considered realizable,
    however, could be increased in the near future if the Company
    exhibits sufficient positive evidence in future periods that
    demonstrate the continuation of its trend in projected earnings
    is achievable. The tax benefit of these credits and loss
    carryforwards attributable to non- variable stock options will
    be accounted for as a credit to shareholders&#146; equity rather
    than a reduction of income tax expense. Included in the
    valuation allowance are $134.9&#160;million and
    $162.9&#160;million as of October&#160;28, 2006 and
    October&#160;29, 2005, respectively that would be credited to
    shareholders&#146; equity associated with stock options.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of October&#160;28, 2006, the Company had federal net
    operating loss carryforwards of $337.2&#160;million and state
    net operating loss carryforwards of $134.9&#160;million.
    Additionally, the Company has $36.8&#160;million of federal tax
    credits and $52.5&#160;million of state tax credits. The federal
    net operating loss and other tax credit carryforwards expire on
    various dates between 2016 through 2024; the state net operating
    loss carryforwards expire on various dates between 2007 through
    2024. Under the current tax law, net operating loss and credit
    carryforwards available to offset future income in any given
    year may be limited by statute or upon the occurrence of certain
    events, including significant changes in ownership interests.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In November 2005, we were notified by the Internal Revenue
    Service that our domestic federal income tax return for the year
    ended October&#160;25, 2003 was subject to audit. The IRS Audit
    is ongoing and we believe our reserves are adequate to cover any
    potential assessments that may result from the examination.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In April 2006, we were notified by the Franchise Tax Board
    (&#147;FTB&#148;) that our California income tax returns for the
    years ended October&#160;25, 2003 and October&#160;30, 2004 were
    subject to audit. The FTB Audit is ongoing and we believe our
    reserves are adequate to cover any potential assessments that
    may result from the examination.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">14.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Segment
    Information</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company is organized and operates as one operating segment:
    the design, development, manufacturing, marketing and selling of
    infrastructure for storage area networks (&#147;SANs&#148;). The
    Chief Executive Officer is the Company&#146;s Chief Operating
    Decision Maker (CODM), as defined by SFAS&#160;131,
    &#147;Disclosures about Segments of an Enterprise and Related
    Information.&#148; The CODM allocates resources and assesses the
    performance of the Company based on consolidated revenues and
    overall profitability.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Revenues are attributed to geographic areas based on the
    location of the customer to which products are shipped. Domestic
    revenues include sales to certain OEM customers who take
    possession of Brocade products domestically and then distribute
    those products to their international customers. The percent of
    revenue derived from domestic and international customers for
    the years ended October&#160;28, 2006, October&#160;29, 2005 and
    October&#160;30, 2004, is as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For the year ended October&#160;28, 2006, three customers
    accounted for 31&#160;percent, 22&#160;percent and
    20&#160;percent of total revenues, respectively. For the year
    ended October&#160;29, 2005, the same three customers accounted
    for 29&#160;percent, 21&#160;percent, and 21&#160;percent of
    total revenues, respectively. For the year ended
    October&#160;30, 2004, also the same three customers accounted
    for 29&#160;percent, 22&#160;percent, and 19&#160;percent of
    total revenues, respectively. The level of sales to any single
    customer may vary and the loss of any one of these customers, or
    a decrease in the level of sales to any one of these customers,
    could have a material adverse impact on the Company&#146;s
    financial condition or results of operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">16.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Gain on
    Investments, net</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Net gain on investment of $2.7&#160;million for the year ended
    October&#160;28, 2006, consisted of the disposition of portfolio
    investments primarily associated with non-marketable private
    strategic investments. Net loss on investments of
    $5.1&#160;million for the year ended October&#160;29, 2005
    consisted of $5.2&#160;million in losses on the disposition of
    portfolio investments primarily associated with the defeasance
    of the indenture agreement relating to the Company&#146;s
    2%&#160;Convertible Notes, offset by $0.1&#160;million gains on
    the disposition of non-marketable private strategic investments.
    Net gain on investments of $0.4&#160;million for the year ended
    October&#160;30, 2004 consisted of gains on the disposition of
    non-marketable private strategic investments. The carrying value
    of the Company&#146;s equity investments in non-publicly traded
    companies at October&#160;28, 2006, October&#160;29, 2005 and
    October&#160;30, 2004 was $0.8&#160;million, $3.8&#160;million
    and $0.5&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    88
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BROCADE
    COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS, INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#160;&#151;&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">17.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Net
    Income (Loss) per Share</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    The following table presents the calculation of basic and
    diluted net income (loss) per common share (in&#160;thousands,
    except per share amounts):
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For the years ended October&#160;28, 2006 and October&#160;29,
    2005, potential common shares in the form of stock options to
    purchase 26.6&#160;million and 30.6&#160;million
    weighted-average shares of common stock, respectively, were
    antidilutive and, therefore, not included in the computation of
    diluted earnings per share. For the year ended October&#160;30,
    2004, stock options outstanding of 49.5&#160;million shares were
    antidilutive as the Company had a net loss and, therefore, were
    not included in the computation of diluted earnings per share.
    In addition, for the years ended October&#160;28, 2006,
    October&#160;29, 2005, and October&#160;30, 2004, potential
    common shares resulting from the potential conversion of the
    Company&#146;s convertible subordinated debt of
    5.2&#160;million, 6.8&#160;million, and 9.2&#160;million
    weighted-average common shares were antidilutive, respectively,
    and, therefore, not included in the computation of diluted
    earnings per share.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">18.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Related
    Party and Other Transactions</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the normal course of business the Company purchases
    certain equipment from vendors who are also its customers and
    with whom the Company has contractual arrangements. The
    equipment purchase by the Company is primarily used for testing
    purposes in its development labs or otherwise consumed
    internally. The Company believes that all such transactions are
    on an arms-length basis and subject to terms no more favorable
    than those with unrelated parties.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">19.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Subsequent
    Events</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On November&#160;17, 2006, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors
    determined to terminate the shareholder rights plan through an
    amendment to the rights plan to accelerate the termination date
    of the shareholder rights plan. Brocade intends to implement
    this amendment in the near future.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On November&#160;17, 2006, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors
    amended the 1999 Stock Plan to expressly permit the grant of
    restricted stock units, including performance-based restricted
    stock units.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    89
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
